name: Flax Seed Crackers
author: Chef John
summary: I heard that if you mix flax seeds with an equal amount of water, soak them, and spread them thin, you'll get a tasty cracker. I heard right! These have a nutty, earthy flavor. They're light, but still sturdy enough for dips and spreads. Experiment with other seasonings if you like.
directions: Place flax seeds in mixing bowl
Add salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne
Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C)
Line a rimmed baking sheeting with a silicone mat or parchment
Transfer soaked flax seeds to prepared baking sheet
Spread out into a thin, flat rectangle, about 1/8 inch thick, using a spatula
Score the rectangle into about 32 small, rectangles
Bake in preheated oven until flax seeds have darkened and contracted slightly, about 3 hours
Cool in oven with door ajar
